bioghist.p: Gwen Davis (b. 1936) is an American novelist and poet. She graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1954. While she has authored a number of books and articles, she is perhaps most known for being sued for libel by the alleged subject of her 1971 novel Touching, which was about a psychoanalyst who advocated nude analysis. When she and her publisher, Doubleday, were found liable for damages by the court, Doubleday sued her to recover its costs, a controversial break from customary practice in the publishing business.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of manuscripts of novels, stories, screenplays, and poems by Gwen Davis. Also included are letters from editors and publishers, materials relating to the libel lawsuit, research notes for stories, and publicity materials and clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
